paragraphs.name: 3c55
paragraphs.text: Today’s 24 hours will move faster than yesterday’s. Tomorrow’s 24 hours will go faster still. I graduated college, went to sleep, and then woke up the next day to my 3 year anniversary with a company I swore I’d only be at for a few weeks.
If you wish to be more visible in the world, you will have to do a lot of INvisible work.
paragraphs.name: 9d0a

paragraphs.text: A) STOP BINGING ON PODCASTS
paragraphs.name: 46f1

paragraphs.text: I dare you to learn as much from everyone around you as you possibly can first. Then feel free to read more books.
paragraphs.name: 4bf5

paragraphs.text: If you wish to be more visible in the world, you will have to do a lot of INvisible work.
paragraphs.name: 9d0a

paragraphs.text: No matter how many books you’ve written (or haven’t), no matter how big your dreams are (or aren’t), no matter how much “potential” you have (or don’t) — you have 24 hours.
paragraphs.name: 2b89

paragraphs.text: As a result of that 6 months, I now am able to animate at a decent level. I am able to cut my own videos instead of paying way too much for outsourcing.
paragraphs.name: 77b1
f69e
paragraphs.text: When you are dumb, people tell you everything they know. Ask them to repeat it once. Write it down. Then talk to yourself about it on the way home.

3b500aa85882.title: The part about multitasking versus mono tasking is so on-point!

paragraphs.name: 344e
paragraphs.text: The part about multitasking versus mono tasking is so on-point! I keep juggling multiple tasks but at the end of the day I would end up with a pile of incomplete things. I used to find solace in starting multiple tasks, “it would increase my area of expertise” is what I used to think. Not anymore though. The sooner the realisation strikes the better. Thanks for the wonderful read as usual Todd!
